text:
"Kde domov můj" (pron. [ɡdɛ ˈdomof muːj] "gdeh DOH-mohf MOO-ee") is the national anthem of the Czech Republic. It—combined with the lyrics of "Nad Tatrou sa blýska"—was used as the anthem of Czechoslovakia, and after Czechoslovakia splitted into Czechia and Slovakia, "Kde domov můj" became the anthem of the former (Czechia, the short-form name for the Czech Republic). It was created by Josef Kajetán Tyl and František Škroup in 1834 and was first published in the play "Fidlovačka aneb žádný hněv a žádná rvačka".
Czech original.
The lyrics were written by Fidlovačka in 1834. Only the first verse is used as the anthem.
Czechoslovakia: 1918–92 lyrics.
See also "Nad Tatrou sa blýska".
Poetic English translation.
This version was translated into English by Czech poet Václav Sládek (1845–1912).
German version.
Between 1918 and 1938 there was an official version in German by Karl Wenzel Ernst.
Hungarian version.
Between the same years there was an official version in Hungarian.
